clipR 0.1.16
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Standard/BrdU-CLIP data analysis using CTK
    • Using the CTK pipeline wrapper from R

    Readme

    clipR is a R wrapper for the ctk toolkit and additional functions to call other external libraries into an R environment.

    clipR makes use of the CondaSysReqs library to install conda dependencies to your machine within a conda environment using the reticulate libraries.

    The ctk toolkit is installed as part of the clipR install_ctk() function.

    How to install clipR

    install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("RockefellerUniversity/clipR")
devtools::install_github("RockefellerUniversity/CondaSysReqs")
CondaSysReqs::install_CondaSysReqs("clipR")
clipR::install_ctk()

    Path to Conda tools and Ctk/czplib

    library(clipR)

## Warning: replacing previous import 'reticulate::import' by 'rtracklayer::import' when loading 'clipR'

## Warning: replacing previous import 'Biostrings::tail' by 'utils::tail' when loading 'clipR'

## Warning: replacing previous import 'Biostrings::head' by 'utils::head' when loading 'clipR'

## clipR_0.1.16 conda env was not found found at /Users/thomascarroll/Library/r-miniconda/envs/clipR_0.1.16

## For more information on setting up conda environments for clipr, see the CondaSysReqs package

## ctk not found at /Users/thomascarroll/Library/r-miniconda/envs/clipR_0.1.16/bin/ctk

## czplib not found at /Users/thomascarroll/Library/r-miniconda/envs/clipR_0.1.16/lib/czplib

getOption("clipr.condaEnv")

## NULL

getOption("clipr.ctk")

## NULL

getOption("clipr.czplib")

## NULL
